data.text/html:
y = 0.0 + 1.0 × x

Shows the relationship between predictor and outcome. Look for: linear pattern, spread of points around line.
Checks model assumptions. Look for: random scatter around zero (good), patterns/funnel shapes (bad — suggests non-linearity or heteroscedasticity).

Coefficient Interpretation (OLS Estimates)

Intercept (β₀ = 0.27, SE = 0.68, t = 0.40): When x equals 0, the predicted value of y is 0.27. Slope (β₁ = 0.94, SE = 0.13, t = 7.31): For every 1-unit increase in x, y is expected to increase by 0.94 units.
  • SE: standard error of the estimate; smaller = more precise
  • t = β/SE: how many SEs the coefficient is from zero
Model Fit:
  • Residual SE (σ̂) = 2.593 — the standard deviation of residuals; on average, predictions are off by about this much
  • R² = 0.527 — 52.7% of the variance in y is explained by the model
(True DGP: β₀ = 0.0, β₁ = 1.0)

Regression Summary (OLS on simulated data)

Coefficients:
          Estimate Std.Err t value  Pr(>|t|)
(Intercept)      0.271   0.679    0.40  6.92e-01 
x                0.937   0.128    7.31  2.45e-09 ***
---
Signif: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1

Residual SE: 2.593 on 48 df
R-squared: 0.5269, Adj R²: 0.5171
F-statistic: 53.46 on 1 and 48 DF
p-value: 2.45e-09
